text:
Hey everyone, I was wondering if anyone has experience doing a sponsored guest post? We're doing one with a well known publication and we have to fill in a creative brief, and I'm not quite sure how best to answer the questions and make sure we get the most out of what we're paying for.

Would anyone be open to sharing their experience? Also happy to jump on a call and pay $$ for your time/thoughts.

elements.text:
Hey everyone, I was wondering if anyone has experience doing a sponsored guest post? We're doing one with a well known publication and we have to fill in a creative brief, and I'm not quite sure how best to answer the questions and make sure we get the most out of what we're paying for.

Would anyone be open to sharing their experience? Also happy to jump on a call and pay $$ for your time/thoughts.

text: We've done sponsored posts, but 1) we partnered with a company that has a similar audience and could help us reach and engage more of our target audience, and 2) we went into it with a clear strategy. We knew exactly why we were partnering with them and what we expected to get out of it. Based on our KPIs and goals, we could then guide them on the content that would make sense for our target audience as they encountered it within the partner's channels and in their brand voice. We also knew what action we wanted people to take on the partner's end to drive them to our website. If you don't have clarity on those things, then just paying for a sponsored post probably won't deliver much ROI.
